meanings.definition: Written or drawn in a messy or illegible manner.
meanings.sent1: The scrawly note on the paper was hard to read.
meanings.sent2: Her scrawly handwriting made it challenging to decipher the message.
meanings.sent3: The scrawly writing on the wall looked like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The scrawly lines on the canvas seemed to dance with chaos.
meanings.sent5: The scrawly signature on the document was barely recognizable.

meanings.definition: A style of handwriting that is difficult to read.
meanings.sent1: I struggled to read the scrawly in the old diary.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had trouble understanding the student's scrawly.
meanings.sent3: The scrawly in the letter made it seem like a mysterious message.
meanings.sent4: Her scrawly was like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The scrawly in the book looked like a secret language.

meanings.definition: To write or draw in a messy or illegible manner.
meanings.sent1: She would often scrawly notes in her notebook.
meanings.sent2: He scrawly a quick message on the post-it note.
meanings.sent3: The cat managed to scrawly paw prints on the wet paint.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to scrawly patterns in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The artist would scrawly sketches in his sketchbook.
